=  Project GWT Gadget =
 There are two ways you can get a GWT gadget to IGoogle, one through the GWT gadgets API, which is better. The second is to include a standalone module. 

 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-examples/source/browse/trunk/DemoGadgetXml/war/gadget-gwt-examples-ads.xml Source of the example on this page] - Advertising source, stored in the subversion source repository
 * [http://code.google.com/apis/wave/extensions/gadgets/guide.html Docs For Native Javascript] - Native JS Docs
== GWT Gadgets ==
 There is some serious develop going on in the source code. Not sure when the next release is.
 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-google-apis/wiki/GadgetsGettingStarted Google GWT Gadget Reference] - GWT Gadgets Api

== Example GWT Gadget ==
 This is my first gwt gadget, compiled using GWT. This is a fantastic way to get the widget built.

 * [http://code.google.com/p/gwt-examples/source/browse/#svn/trunk/DemoGwtGadget/src/org/gonevertical/demo/client Source] - this is a very basic simple example to make sure it works, and it does.
{{{
wiki:gadget url="http://demogwtgadget.appspot.com/demogwtgadget/org.gonevertical.demo.client.DemoGwtGadget.gadget.xml" height="100" width="400" border="1" />
}}}
